II.iii.2.D.2.b
.
Establishing a Claim Based on VA Medical Treatment Prior to March 24, 2015
Follow the steps in the table below if the VA medical evidence shows treatment prior to March 24, 2015, for
an SC disability, or
manifestations of an SC disability.
Step
Action
1
Accept the date of admission for treatment, date of outpatient treatment, or date of examination for an SC disability as the DOC for increased evaluation.
2
Establish and maintain control of the claim.
Important
:  If unsolicited VA medical evidence, other than reports of hospitalization, shows treatment on or after March 24, 2015,
do not
establish an EP to control for receipt of this evidence.  No further action is needed other than ensuring that records submitted by a claimant are associated with the claims folder, as this evidence may be utilized for effective date purposes if a formal claim is received within one year of the date of treatment.
References
:  For more information on
procedures for processing solicited or unsolicited mail, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart i, 2.A.5.d
circumstances in which it is appropriate to incorporate VA treatment records into the claims folder when not submitted by a claimant, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 1.A.2.b, d, and h
the effective date for an increase in compensation, see
38 CFR 3.400(o)
, and
M21-1, Part V, Subpart ii, 4.A.5
establishing a claim based on VA medical treatment prior to March 24, 2015, see historical
38 CFR 3.157(b)(1)
the characteristics of an informal clam received prior to March 24, 2015, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 2.H.1
accepting medical evidence from an MTF as an informal claim prior to March 24, 2015, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 2.D.2.a
, and
reviewing a report of hospitalization at a VA hospital or MTF dated on or after March 24, 2015, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 2.D.1.a
.
